content:
There are various types of funding available for graduate students at the University of Michigan who are conducting research. Some of the funding sources include:

1. Research fellowships: The University of Michigan offers several research fellowships that graduate students can apply for, including the Rackham Predoctoral Fellowship, Rackham Graduate Student Research Grants, and the Michigan Society of Fellows.

2. Grants: There are various grants available, such as the National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship and the Ford Foundation Fellowship program.

3. Assistantships: Graduate students can work as research or teaching assistants and receive funding for their research or teaching responsibilities.

4. Scholarships and awards: Some departments offer scholarships and awards to their graduate students who demonstrate exceptional research work.

5. External funding: Students can also apply for external funding through organizations such as the National Institutes of Health, National Endowment for the Humanities, and the Fulbright Program.

6. Personal Loans: Some students apply for loans to pay for their research.
